author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 20-year-old woman allegedly committed suicide by hanging on Tuesday evening. Suspecting foul play, her relatives roughed up her husband, Sankar (35), leading to his hospitalisation.

According to police, Manimegalai, a resident of Tiruvannamalai, was married to Sankar of Bajanai Koil Street, Sengadumottur in Walajah taluk four months ago.

Found hanging

At 4 p.m. on Tuesday, she was found hanging in their house. Following this, Sankar informed her family members. Relatives of Manimegalai held Sankar responsible for her death. He was assaulted by 10 persons.

Sankar was admitted to the Government Vellore Medical College Hospital, Adukkamparai. Doctors said his condition was stable.

Manimegalai’s mother Pachaiammal (45) lodged a complaint at the Walajah police station. A case has been registered under section 174 of CrPC. Police said the Revenue Divisional Officer, Ranipet will conduct an inquiry as the woman died within seven years of marriage.

People in need of counselling can contact the State health department’s round-the-clock helpline number – 104. Chennai-based Sneha suicide prevention centre can be contacted at 044-2464 0050.
title: Newly-wed woman commits suicide
